name: Leadership
description: Top management is responsible for the cyber security program and must establish policy, objectives, resources, metrics, and support for leadership roles.
guidance: Ensure security governance aligns with business strategy; track program metrics; and clearly empower leaders to implement the program.

subcontrols.name: Establish policy & objectives
subcontrols.description: Ensure cyber security policy and objectives are established and aligned with the organization's strategic direction.

subcontrols.name: Provide resources
subcontrols.description: Ensure resources needed for the cyber security program are available and aligned with policy and objectives.

subcontrols.name: Communicate importance
subcontrols.description: Communicate the importance of effective cyber security and conforming to the program requirements.

subcontrols.name: Set metrics & track
subcontrols.description: Establish cyber security program metrics and track progress.

subcontrols.name: Support management roles
subcontrols.description: Support other relevant management roles in demonstrating leadership for their areas of responsibility.

name: Accountability
description: Assign a senior leader accountable for cyber security with defined responsibilities.
guidance: Designate a single accountable senior leader to coordinate policy, training, incident response, and risk prioritization.

subcontrols.name: Program implementation
subcontrols.description: Develop and implement a company-wide cyber security program to meet baseline controls.

subcontrols.name: Policies & procedures
subcontrols.description: Document and disseminate information security policies and procedures.

subcontrols.name: Training program
subcontrols.description: Coordinate a company-wide security training and awareness program.

subcontrols.name: Incident coordination
subcontrols.description: Coordinate responses to suspected or actual breaches affecting confidentiality, integrity, or availability.

subcontrols.name: Risk management
subcontrols.description: Identify organizational risks and prioritize treatment relative to likelihood and impact.

name: Cyber security training
description: Train employees on basic security practices; provide ongoing awareness (Level 2).
guidance: Focus training on passwords, phishing, patching, and least privilege; maintain documented, ongoing awareness at Level 2.

subcontrols.name: Password practices
subcontrols.description: Train on compliance with password policies and secure authentication practices.

subcontrols.name: Phishing awareness
subcontrols.description: Train employees to identify malicious communications and phishing.

subcontrols.name: Updates hygiene
subcontrols.description: Train employees to keep devices and software updated.

subcontrols.name: Least privilege
subcontrols.description: Train on principle of least privilege and basic access controls.

subcontrols.name: Ongoing awareness
subcontrols.description: Provide documentation that regular and ongoing security awareness and training are provided.

name: Cyber security risk assessment
description: Conduct cyber security risk assessments; implement and review controls commensurate with risk; maintain asset register and governance artifacts.
guidance: Use risk assessments to understand confidentiality, integrity, and availability risks; determine triggers for reassessment; and verify controls annually or upon major change.

subcontrols.name: Perform assessment
subcontrols.description: Conduct a cyber security risk assessment (self-performed or via third party).

subcontrols.name: Leadership-led assessment
subcontrols.description: Appointed senior leader conducts/coordinates risk assessments and implementation of controls; consult experts as needed.

subcontrols.name: Asset register
subcontrols.description: Develop and maintain an asset register of information systems and IT assets with purpose documented.

subcontrols.name: Document exceptions
subcontrols.description: Document instances where baseline controls are not implemented with accepted inherent/residual risks authorized by a senior official.

subcontrols.name: Budget & staffing
subcontrols.description: Identify cyber security spend (amount and % of total) and staffing (count and % of total).

subcontrols.name: Continuous improvement
subcontrols.description: Commit to progressive cyber security improvements and define triggers/thresholds for reassessment.

subcontrols.name: Baseline controls
subcontrols.description: Implement baseline controls in Sections 5 and applicable Section 6 as foundational minimums regardless of assessment outcome.

subcontrols.name: Testing & review
subcontrols.description: Review and/or test controls at least annually or upon major change to ensure effectiveness.

subcontrols.name: Workforce with access
subcontrols.description: Document total employees, part-time employees, and contractors that may access organizational data.

name: Incident response plan
description: Establish, test, and maintain an incident response plan; include contacts and communication mechanisms; consider cyber insurance.
guidance: Adopt a lifecycle such as PICERL; coordinate with third parties where appropriate; maintain hard copy availability.

subcontrols.name: Plan for incident types
subcontrols.description: Maintain an incident response plan for different incident types and severities; define approach when internal capability is insufficient.

subcontrols.name: Roles & comms
subcontrols.description: Identify responsible roles, external contacts (e.g., breach counsel, regulators), and communication mechanisms; keep a hard copy accessible.

subcontrols.name: Test the plan
subcontrols.description: Test the incident response plan; include third-party providers where appropriate.

subcontrols.name: Cyber insurance
subcontrols.description: Consider purchasing cyber insurance covering incident response and recovery or document rationale for not purchasing.

subcontrols.name: Use template
subcontrols.description: Optionally use the template provided in Annex A to satisfy plan requirements.

name: Automatic patching
description: Maintain up-to-date patches; enable automatic updates where possible; assess replacing systems incapable of automatic patching.
guidance: Enable automatic updates on OS, applications, firmware, and security software; establish manual processes if automation is unavailable.

subcontrols.name: Up-to-date patches
subcontrols.description: Maintain up-to-date security patches for all software and hardware.

subcontrols.name: Enable automatic updates
subcontrols.description: Enable automatic patching for all software and hardware or document business decisions not to; establish manual update process where needed.

subcontrols.name: Assess replacements
subcontrols.description: Perform a risk assessment to determine whether to replace systems incapable of automatic patching.

name: Enable security software
description: Deploy and enable anti-malware solutions that auto-update and prevent malware execution.
guidance: Use anti-virus/anti-malware across all connected devices; enable host firewalls or comparable alternatives.

subcontrols.name: Anti-malware enabled
subcontrols.description: Enable anti-malware solutions that automatically update and prevent malware from executing.

name: Secure configuration process
description: Implement secure configurations: change defaults, disable unnecessary functions, and enable security features.
guidance: Review vendor defaults; adopt configuration standards (e.g., CIS Benchmarks) and product best practices.

subcontrols.name: Change default passwords
subcontrols.description: Change all default administrative passwords on devices.

subcontrols.name: Disable unnecessary features
subcontrols.description: Block unused ports, disable unused services, and remove obsolete software.

subcontrols.name: Enable security features
subcontrols.description: Enable all relevant device and platform security features.

name: Strong user authentication
description: Implement MFA, enforce password changes upon compromise, and define password policy; implement password manager (Level 2).
guidance: Balance security with usability; MFA significantly increases security; follow national guidance for password selection.

subcontrols.name: Implement MFA
subcontrols.description: Implement multi-factor authentication or document where it is not feasible.

subcontrols.name: Change on compromise
subcontrols.description: Enforce password changes upon suspicion or evidence of compromise.

subcontrols.name: Password policy
subcontrols.description: Define policies on length, reuse, password manager usage, and handling of written passwords.

subcontrols.name: Password manager
subcontrols.description: Implement a password manager or document the business decision not to.

name: Backup and encrypt data
description: Determine critical data/systems and backup frequency; store offsite; protect and test backups; ensure backups are immutable; test recovery.
guidance: Design backup strategy per system criticality; use encryption and protect keys; regularly test restores.

subcontrols.name: Identify essential information
subcontrols.description: Determine essential business information/software and how frequently it changes.

subcontrols.name: Define backup frequency
subcontrols.description: Determine which systems to back up and at what frequency.

subcontrols.name: Backup essential systems
subcontrols.description: Back up systems containing essential information and ensure recovery mechanisms restore effectively.

subcontrols.name: Offsite storage
subcontrols.description: Store backups at a fully offsite location at regular intervals for disaster resilience.

subcontrols.name: Encrypt backups
subcontrols.description: Use encrypted backups with securely stored and recoverable keys; restrict access to keys and unencrypted backups.

subcontrols.name: Immutability
subcontrols.description: Ensure backup files are not modifiable to maintain data integrity.

subcontrols.name: Test backups
subcontrols.description: Regularly test critical backups for security and integrity.

subcontrols.name: Test restores
subcontrols.description: Sample backup data to verify recovery procedures at regular intervals.

name: Perimeter defenses
description: Implement network and email perimeter defenses including firewalls, DNS filtering, VPN, secure Wi‑Fi, segmentation, and email authentication.
guidance: Use network and host firewalls, DNS firewalling, encrypted remote access (VPN + MFA), WPA2/WPA3 Enterprise, segmentation, and DMARC/DKIM/SPF + filtering.

subcontrols.name: Network firewall
subcontrols.description: Place a firewall between perimeters to control traffic kinds and amounts.

subcontrols.name: DNS firewall
subcontrols.description: Implement a DNS firewall for outbound DNS requests to the Internet.

subcontrols.name: Host firewalls or alternatives
subcontrols.description: Activate software firewalls on devices or document alternative measures.

subcontrols.name: Secure remote access
subcontrols.description: Require encrypted connectivity to corporate resources and VPN with MFA for all remote access.

subcontrols.name: Secure Wi‑Fi
subcontrols.description: Use secure Wi‑Fi (minimum WPA2‑AES; preferably WPA2‑Enterprise or WPA3‑Enterprise) and manage passwords per policy.

subcontrols.name: Network segmentation
subcontrols.description: Segment networks; isolate public/customer networks from corporate networks.

subcontrols.name: Email authentication
subcontrols.description: Implement DMARC, DKIM, and SPF on all organization email services.

subcontrols.name: Email filtering
subcontrols.description: Ensure email filtering is implemented.

subcontrols.name: Home network isolation
subcontrols.description: Encourage/require users to join a separate network (e.g., guest) for work when working from home, or document rationale not to.

name: Access control and authorization
description: Apply least privilege; restrict admin privileges; remove access when no longer required; centralize authentication (Level 2).
guidance: Provision minimum necessary access; separate admin and user activities; prefer centralized identity services.

subcontrols.name: Provision minimum access
subcontrols.description: Provision accounts with minimum functionality necessary and restrict administrator privileges to as‑required.

subcontrols.name: Deprovision promptly
subcontrols.description: Remove accounts and functionality when users no longer require them.

subcontrols.name: Separate admin use
subcontrols.description: Permit administrator accounts only for administrative activities (not email/web browsing).

subcontrols.name: Centralized auth
subcontrols.description: Implement a centralized authentication system (e.g., directory or identity service).

name: Secure mobility
description: Educate mobile users on safe connectivity; define device ownership and enforce separation, EMM, encryption, and safe network usage (Level 2).
guidance: Decide on COPE vs BYOD; separate work/personal data; control app sources; prefer EMM to manage/wipe devices.

subcontrols.name: Disable auto-join
subcontrols.description: Educate users to disable automatic connections to open networks.

subcontrols.name: Avoid untrusted Wi‑Fi
subcontrols.description: Avoid connecting to untrusted Wi‑Fi networks.

subcontrols.name: Limit Bluetooth/NFC
subcontrols.description: Limit use of Bluetooth and NFC for sensitive exchanges.

subcontrols.name: Prefer corporate or cellular
subcontrols.description: Use corporate Wi‑Fi or cellular data rather than public Wi‑Fi.

subcontrols.name: Use secure connectivity
subcontrols.description: Use secure connectivity (e.g., VPN or virtual desktop) when on public Wi‑Fi.

subcontrols.name: Ownership model
subcontrols.description: Decide and document device ownership model and associated risks (e.g., COPE vs BYOD).

subcontrols.name: Separate work & personal
subcontrols.description: Require separation of work and personal data on devices with corporate access; document how separation is enforced.

subcontrols.name: Trusted app sources
subcontrols.description: Ensure employees only download apps from organization's trusted sources.

subcontrols.name: Encrypt mobile data
subcontrols.description: Require that all mobile devices store sensitive information in a secure, encrypted state.

subcontrols.name: Enterprise Mobility Mgmt
subcontrols.description: Implement an EMM solution or document risks of not implementing one.

subcontrols.name: Enforce safe usage
subcontrols.description: Enforce safe network usage requirements or document rationale if not enforced.

name: Secure cloud and outsourced IT services
description: Assess risk tolerance and provider handling of sensitive data; assess providers and jurisdictions; secure communications; require MFA for admin accounts.
guidance: Perform vendor risk analysis; require recognized certifications/reports or justify exceptions; ensure secure connectivity to cloud services.

subcontrols.name: Assess tolerance
subcontrols.description: Evaluate risk tolerance with how outsourced providers handle and access sensitive information.

subcontrols.name: Vendor risk assessment
subcontrols.description: Complete a risk assessment of externally provided services (use Vendor Risk Analysis Questionnaire).

subcontrols.name: Compliance reports
subcontrols.description: Require external providers to share reports demonstrating compliance (e.g., SOC 2, ISO/IEC 27001, PCI-DSS, ISO/IEC 20000, CAN/DGSI 104, or equivalent), or document business case not to.

subcontrols.name: Data flow & jurisdiction
subcontrols.description: Assess risks of data transmission and storage (including legal jurisdictions).

subcontrols.name: Secure communications
subcontrols.description: Ensure IT infrastructure and users communicate securely with all cloud services and applications.

subcontrols.name: Admin MFA & separation
subcontrols.description: Ensure all administrative cloud accounts use MFA and differ from internal administrator accounts.

name: Secure websites
description: Address OWASP Top 10 risks; remediate high/medium risks; define ASVS level for each website.
guidance: Use OWASP Top 10 and ASVS to baseline requirements; include ASVS in contracts for outsourced sites.

subcontrols.name: Awareness of OWASP Top 10
subcontrols.description: Demonstrate awareness of the OWASP Top 10 web application risks.

subcontrols.name: Remediate Top 10 risks
subcontrols.description: Remediate high and medium OWASP Top 10 risks for primary marketing websites to acceptable risk levels.

subcontrols.name: Define ASVS level
subcontrols.description: Define the OWASP ASVS level required for each website.

name: Secure portable media
description: Limit to organization-owned secure portable media; enforce asset control, encryption, and proper sanitization/disposal.
guidance: Control use of USB/portable media; prefer encrypted, org-provided devices; maintain lifecycle management.

subcontrols.name: Org-owned only
subcontrols.description: Mandate sole use of organization-owned secure portable media.

subcontrols.name: Asset control
subcontrols.description: Maintain strong asset control for portable media devices.

subcontrols.name: Encrypt devices
subcontrols.description: Require encryption on all portable media devices.

subcontrols.name: Sanitize/dispose
subcontrols.description: Sanitize or destroy portable media prior to disposal.

name: Point of sale (POS) & financial systems
description: Follow PCI DSS for POS/financial systems; segment them from other networks with firewalls.
guidance: Isolate POS/financial networks from Internet and corporate networks; adhere to PCI DSS.

subcontrols.name: PCI DSS compliance
subcontrols.description: Follow the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) for POS and financial systems.

name: Computer security log management
description: Establish log management policy and procedures (Level 2); include log backups and appropriate retention.
guidance: Log authentication, security, file access, device status, firewall/IDS; set retention per legal and business needs.

subcontrols.name: Policy & procedure
subcontrols.description: Define a log management policy (including log backup) and procedure to implement it; set retention as appropriate.
